Message to Parents of Primary School students...

We are so excited to welcome students back tomorrow for the first day of school! This is an emotional and exciting time for both parents and students. Our staff will be welcoming students and assisting them to their grade level doors. If you are driving your student(s) to school, please drop them off in the primary drop off zone in the parking lot off of Peters Street. Second graders will enter through the main doors next to the office. First graders will enter through the doors at the southeast corner of the kindergarten playground. Unfortunately, parents may not accompany students to the playground or the building at this time. Students will go directly to their classrooms upon arrival. Thank you for your support as we begin the school year tomorrow. We look forward to seeing everyone!

Great Summer Opportunity...

LOCKWOOD ART CLASS FOR YOUNG PEOPLE (6 AND UP)

After a long spring at home for many young people, Lesman Studio in Lockwood is offering a 4 day hands on art workshop for children, teaching fundamental drawing and beginning watercolor painting. Students may choose the morning class 9:00 a.m. to noon or the afternoon session 1:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. The Workshop will last 4 days, Monday June 22 thru Thursday June 25. Class size is limited to 6 students and costs $60.00 for the 4 day workshop. Because of the Covid Virus, students are asked to bring their own snacks for mid session break as well as their own water or juice. All art supplies are provided. Studio is at 18 Maier Road off of HWY. 87 E.

Long time instructor is Mana Lesman, former art teacher at Lockwood School and Billings Parks and Rec. and an exhibiting artist in Billings for the past 35 years. To enroll call 406-252-5780.
